statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: George Mason 78, Northeastern 53
article.story: FAIRFAX, Va. (AP) -- Will Thomas scored 20 points on 10-for-11 shooting to lead George Mason to a 78-53 victory over Northeastern on Saturday. George Mason (11-7, 5-3 Colonial Athletic Association), which led 36-30 at halftime, opened the second half with a 22-11 run to put away the Huskies. Thomas scored six straight points midway through the second half to give the Patriots a 64-43 lead. George Mason's largest advantage was 71-45 and came after a 3-pointer by Dre Smith. Adrian Martinez scored 15 points to lead Northeastern (5-14, 3-5). Matt Janning (12 points) and Manny Adako (10 points) also notched double figures for the Huskies, who have lost 14 straight on the road. Martinez's second 3-pointer of the game sparked a 12-3 Huskies' run as Northeastern took its only lead, 25-24, on a basket by Bobby Kelly with 6:32 remaining in the first half. John Vaughan scored 16 points for the Patriots, who have won five straight by an average of 20 points. Additionally, George Mason has held 16 straight opponents under 70 points. Over the last four games, Thomas has connected on 30 of 38 (78.9 percent) field goal attempts. His 10-for-11 (90.9 percent) showing against the Huskies is third all-time in George Mason history.
